description: Just over a week ago, the Israeli military sent ground troops into Lebanon to push the militant group Hezbollah back from the border. Our correspondent got as close a look at this invasion as possible, from a town ten miles from the border. He tells us what he saw.
title: On the frontline of Israel's invasion of Lebanon

description: The area has not taken a direct hit from a hurricane in over 100 years. But its topography and dense population make it especially susceptible to severe damage from storm surges.
title: Why Tampa Bay is at such high risk for hurricane damage

description: A lynx stretching in the sun, tadpoles swimming beneath lily pads and an investigator dusting a tusk for prints are among the winning images from the newest Wildlife Photographer of the Year awards.
title: Lynx, tiger and tadpoles, oh my: See the Wildlife Photographer of the Year winners

description: The Tropicana, the third-oldest casino on the Las Vegas Strip, closed in April after welcoming guests for 67 years. An elaborate implosion reduced it to rubble on Wednesday.
title: Implosion brings down Tropicana casino in Vegas to make way for baseball stadium

description: The emergency management agency has long tried to respond to rumors that might delay recovery efforts. But a former FEMA official says the current information environment has never been so bad.
title: How FEMA tries to combat rumors and conspiracy theories about Milton and Helene

description: The key presidential states of Georgia and North Carolina were hit particularly hard by Hurricane Helene. NPR compared which counties qualify for FEMA aid with 2020 election results. The area is largely Republican.
title: The swing-state counties hit by Hurricane Helene mostly voted for Trump in 2020

description: The election and Atlantic hurricane seasons are overlapping with dramatic effect, and not for the first time. Here's what we can learn from other storms that shaped elections, from Katrina to Maria.
title: How could hurricanes impact the election? What we can learn from 5 recent storms

description: Hurricane Milton is expected to make landfall in Florida late tonight as a dangerous storm, and time is running out for people to evacuate. And, the EPA has mandated a nationwide lead pipe removal.
title: Time is short to evacuate for Hurricane Milton. And, EPA mandates lead pipe removal

description: Researchers work to grow grass that will offer the same level playing field for athletes at the various soccer venues that will be used during the 2026 FIFA World Cup
title: Researchers work to make pitch-perfect turf for the 2026 World Cup

description: The Nobel Prize in chemistry was awarded Wednesday to David Baker, Demis Hassabis and John Jumper for their work with proteins. The awards continue with the literature prize on Thursday.
title: Nobel Prize in chemistry awarded to scientists for work on proteins

description: The philanthropist is spending $1 billion — and leveraging her ever-growing celebrity — to call more attention to the systemic problems facing women and girls. Now she's focusing even more on women's health.
title: Only 2% of charitable giving goes to women. Can Melinda French Gates change that?

description: When Mary Ann Roser and her husband moved to Asheville four months ago they introduced themselves to neighbors as “climate refugees from Austin.” After Helene, she has thoughts on “climate havens."
title: They came to Asheville looking for a 'climate haven.' Then came Hurricane Helene

description: The National Hurricane Center predicts the storm surge can get as high as 15 feet in some places, and rainfall totals could reach 18 inches.
title: Evacuation windows narrow as Hurricane Milton approaches Florida

description: People who are in jail and haven't been convicted of a crime — and even many who have been convicted — retain their right to vote. But it's often challenging for them to exercise it.
title: Many people in jail have the right to vote. So do many felons

description: In a state where every vote matters, both Democratic and Republican campaigns are not only trying to win in counties where they’re strongest, they’re also trying to lose by less.
title: In battleground states, it's not just about winning — but also losing by less

description: Richard Glossip has had nine execution dates set over the years. He's eaten his last meal three times. He was tried twice and has had multiple appeals, including one at the Supreme Court.
title: True crime drama at Supreme Court pits Oklahoma against its top criminal court

description: The annual Fat Bear Week honors bears that have sufficiently bulked up in the months before entering hibernation.
title: In a rematch, mama bear Grazer defeats rival that killed her cub to win Fat Bear Week

description: In the year since the devastating Oct. 7 attacks on Israel, tens of thousands of Palestinians have been killed. Even more have been injured or displaced. Still, many Palestinians across the diaspora feel that they aren't allowed to share their stories — that the fullness of their humanity is too often reduced to a few soundbites on the news, or images of people dying. So on this episode, we're revisiting conversations with Fady Joudah and Tariq Luthun — two Palestinian American poets who have tried to carve out space to expand the kind of stories that Palestinians are allowed to tell.
title: Two Palestinian writers on the right to share their stories

description: After a federal judge ruled in August that Google is illegally monopolizing the search engine market, the Department of Justice is now saying the company must be reined in.
title: Justice Department calls for sanctions against Google in landmark antitrust case

description: Researchers found that Hurricane Helene was stronger, rainier, and significantly more likely because of climate change. The U.S. can expect more such storms in the future as warming continues.
title: Climate change made Helene more dangerous. It also makes similar storms more likely
